1.text: Mix the sauces, sherry, sugar, sesame oil, and pepper in a small bowl.

2.text: Heat the olive oil in a wok over high heat.

3.text: Add the onion and carrot and cook them in oil for 2 minutes.

4.text: Toss in the snow peas and corn and cook everything for 2 minutes.

5.text: Add the cabbage and cook the mixture for 1 more minute.

6.text: Add the noodles and sauce and stir-fry everything for 2-3 minutes.

7.text: Garnish your dish with sesame seeds before serving it.

8.text: Mix the Tamari sauce, garlic, and ginger together in a bowl.

9.text: Pour the mixture over the tofu and refrigerate it for 10-60 minutes.

10.text: Cook the noodles in heated olive oil in a separate pan.

11.text: Heat up 1⁄4  c (59 mL) of olive oil in a wok.

12.text: Add the garlic, ginger, scallions, and chili and stir-fry for 2 minutes.

13.text: Put the tofu in the wok and stir-fry the mixture for 2 minutes.

14.text: Add the vinegar, bok choy, cabbage, pea pods, and edamame.

15.text: Toss in the noodles and stir-fry the mixture for 1 more minute.

16.text: Mix in the bean sprouts right before serving the dish.
